p.s: A few days ago I've come accrossacross a very old ladder at my grandparentsgrandparent's attic.
When I opened it, I saw that the letter contains Sonnet 65 written by you.
I was very interested in how old the letter was until I realized you addressed the letter to the future descendantesdescendants of my family, which is me.
Even toughthough your body is dead for a while now, I'm sure your soul will read my response.
In general I wanted to say that I liked the sonnet very much even though it was hard to read at some points.
I think that the topic you mentioned is a topic which everyone can relate to.
I liked how you included several metaphors to characterize the youth or the time.
While I read the sonnet many pictures came to my head and I imagined the situation very well just because you described the fears of vanishing so well.
I do not want to sound like an admirer but I really do think that the way you wrote your texts is very unique.
I have barely come accrossacross writers that managed to write as much ahead of their time as you did.
In addition to that your sonnet, addressed to me, reminds me on how short my life actually is and I think it's outstanding that you managed to do that with only 14 lines.
Even though some people say your sonnets are always the same, I personally think that each of them is unique in their very own way.
Maybe you already know it but you as a character still isare one of the most famous authors in the whole world.
Your extraordinary work managed to be still relevant today, the 21th21st century.
The lyrical genius of you is remarkable because you have shaped the English language.
When somebody speaks English today it is nearly impossible to say a sentence without using the word that you invented.
As I already said in the beginning I still could relate to the topics of the sonnet.
I am also not the only one who is able to do that.
All of the topics in your sonnets are timeless and almost everyone still worries about them daily.
Your influence is bigger than you might have thought during your lifetime.
There are even moons flying around Jupiter who are named after characters out of your plays.
The plays you wrote are still significant in every good theater and every student has already read at least one of your plays.
Even if you probably cannot read this response, I will send it to the CLub Guiletta anyways.
It is a club honoring the play Romeo and Juliet you wrote, which helps many people who go through a hard time.

This whole response might have sounded like a whole declaration of love to you but I hope that you understood how important you were for language in general and how huge your influence on us still is today.
